replies.author: oussamabadr

replies.bodyText:
I personally have no opinion about this.
@leonard84 could you elaborate why .mp4 would be the better choice? Would be happy to endorse this instead and change it in this PR, if it is the better choice for whatever reason.
replies.author: kiview

replies.bodyText:
FLV is a proprietary format developed by Adobe. MP4 is a format standardized by the ISO in the MPEG-4 family. Your video is H.264 (MPEG-4 Part 10), so it's from the same MPEG-4 standard.2


That being said, the support for MP4 should always be better than for FLV containers. While typical desktop video players support almost every container and codec, devices such as mobile phones or DLNA streaming servers might only handle MP4 files.

https://superuser.com/a/549647
replies.author: leonard84

replies.bodyText:
I can also add this blog article of Adobe about flv being obsolete:

If you want to create a video to play in Flash Player, then you should generally be using H.264 (.mp4), not the obsolete FLV or F4V formats...

https://blogs.adobe.com/creativecloud/removal-flv-f4v-swf-export-adobe-media-encoder-after-effects-premiere-pro/
Maybe we should consider using .mp4 format, but is there any impact on users ? if so, should we just mark .flv as deprecated and offer .mp4 as option (or as default) and mention that .flv support will be deleted soon ?
If not, we can replace it right away.
replies.author: oussamabadr

replies.bodyText:
IMHO we should offer mp4 as default and could offer a legacy mode that produces flv.
I don't think that there are any who specifically want flv, we currently transcode it in a post processing  step to mp4.
Sure this change breaks that, but that is the whole point, and we can just remove the step with this feature.
